resources.string:
Tests the selecting of an alternative route line. 

1. Long press a point on the map in order to get a primary route and at least one alternative route. 

2. Select an alternative route by touching it. The touched route should appear as the primary route and the previous primary route should appear as an alternative. 

3. Click start navigation and make sure the puck follows the selected route.
Displays a restricted section of a route. \n\nYou should see a section near the middle of the route that has a magenta colored, dashed line appearance.

Dynamically adjusts the traffic congestion on a route line. 

Briefly after the activity starts the traffic congestion on the route line will be randomly updated. 

Notice the route line is partially "vanished". There should be no redrawing or blinking of the "vanished" section of the route line.

The inactive leg of the route should be colored differently than the active leg. 

When the activity starts you should see a route with a waypoint roughly in the middle. Notice the styling of the route which includes traffic congestion. 

Start navigation and the second leg of the route should change color. 

When the puck reaches the waypoint and transitions to the second leg the first leg should take on the coloring of the second leg and the second leg should appear as it did before navigation with the traffic congestion markers.

Screen to test feedback in ActiveGuidance and FreeDrive. Click on "START NAVIGATION" button to start FreeDrive session or long click on the map to get a route from current location to tapped and then click "START NAVIGATION" button to start ActiveGuidance session. Then you can observe in logcat how feedback is sent by clicking on `Feedback` button on the screen.
